title: I Spent 12 Hours at a Japanese Arcade, It was weird. (Collab w/ @PewDiePie )

comments.comment: Honestly, this is the kind of stuff i love seeing you do. Things you haven't done before on the channel, different video styles and just mixing it up a little. Seeing you genuinely excited and doing things you like just makes the whole experience so enjoyable. Please, never be afraid to do random videos on whatever you like, just like this one.
Man, Felix looks so damn happy. You can tell this dude is already living his best life, deserved.
Going to a Japanese arcade is like the fever dream of a 15 year old gamer.
seeing pewdiepie happy is so fcking wholesome man. it's like your childhood hero aging well and doing whatever he wants
I like your narrating style in this one - your lines came off a lot funnier and well presented and the pacing was perfect. Well done!
imagine living in japan being a fan of felix, randomly walking into an arcade and there he is just happy playing the games

Pewdiepie is so relatable. Like when I was young, I was so anxious to do these kinds of stuff alone, especially in an arcade. But when you're older, It's like you got a whole new freedom and just don't care about what people think around you. I like enjoying arcades, coffee, and even eating at a busy fast food chain alone. I spend my day off like this and it's so refreshing. But I guess Japan is a whole new world of Introverts that I WOULD LOVE to discover
PewDiePie seems a lot happier now that he's in Japan. Great to see him doing well.
Loved this type of editing, Felix! You did such a good job on this and we felt as though we're with you trying out the games. So much fun!!

Tbh it's kinda cool seeing PewDiePie in Japan in a arcade. Imagine if he was in America in an arcade game? They wouldn't even let him play! He'd get bombarded with fans wanting pictures and autographs! Japan looks so chill!
I can’t believe he actually moved to Japan to be able to make this video. That’s dedication. So glad to be part of the channel before it blows up.

As a rhythm game player, this tier list is quite accurate (At least in terms of popularity in my area), nostlagia is pretty niche, and Beatmania IIDX is usually for experienced players because it's considered as one of the hardest arcade rhythm game. Sega's rhythm game is also easy to get into as beginner, so no wonder it's on high tier list. Happy to see pewds trying it!
The effort for that clip at 1:24 was worth it and appreciated XD
The disappearance of arcades in the west is a bloody national tragedy, so glad they somehow stayed alive in Japan somewhat at least!.
he sounds so much happier than he was before japan, and doing this kinda content, im so happy for u dude
This video's editing is so good. Good job Felix.
I love this era of the channel, exploring Japan together.
Bro please don’t stop doing these vlogs I j spent hours watching every single one since you moved to Japan love it man
You can tell that you’re out of your comfort zone in this video and that genuinely makes it so entertaining hahah I loved it

can we take sometime to appreciate the fact that Felix hungout at the arcade by himself... this is the ultimate confidence and deserves as much respect as it can get - going anywhere solo is underrated and lets be honest we need to spend more time with ourselves to become better people. Plus hanging out anywhere by yourself is often shit talked in this era... solo king.
feels so weird to see you make this kind of videos, yet so fresh. man is really doing whatever he wants to do and I'm loving it

6:10 

Pewds saying "The songs are so good" while the game is playing New Genesis from Film Red made me so inexplicably happy :)

You can tell your not used to this style, but it was a lot of fun, and I actually learned a lot! Glad you got to live out a childhood fantasy! I look forward to more videos like this, and seeing how you improve <3
you can TELL how much FUN he had making this, and put tons of effort into describing the games too
Wacca, Sound Voltex, Maimai, Chunithm and Dancerush are some of the most fun rhythm arcade games I’ve ever played, surprised and happy to see you try them Pewds!

the "i want the babes to say welcome back, NOT welcome" displays pews true seriousness. He has never said anything that serious ahahhahaha 
Also, can anyone tell me which arcade is this? Would wanna put this on my Japan to-go places ~
Imagine casually going to a Japanese arcade and meeting pewdiepie.
These PewDiePie type of videos are so fun and relaxing honestly.
Absolutely loved this style of video.  A mini-documentary on a topic I didn’t even know I was interested in!  Your humor is elite, I could watch you talk about anything and still love it
You are a lot funnier than people give you credit for. I was laughing the whole time at your commentary.
Definitely need more of these where you go around Japan trying all sorts of things
The dialogue and comedy over the footage was top notch! Well done Felix!
i really like how i don't need to increase the playback speed of his videos because the voiceover and talking speed is already a great pace. love your vids!

I live in Japan currently. Taiko no Tatsujin (the drum game) is my absolute favorite game to play there.  I can spend hours in a japanese arcade playing their rhythm games. When you see a random stranger be a pro at one of the games. You cant help to just sit and stare. Its so satisfying seeing those guys play.

im so used to see him in a laidback mode recently so seeing him so spontaneus with jumpy edit is so unfamiliar , even the jeep video is full of activities but still have laidback vibe and relaxing

which is weird because i watch pewds since his amnesia days and remembered back then he is so active  and extra and always look like extrovert having fun and i like it

maybe im getting old as well

12:38

IT'S JORGON!!!!! YOU JUST HAVE TO BELIVE IN HIM FELIX
I was around 12 or 13 when I first started watching Felix and Marzia, I'm 23 now and it's so inspiring seeing them grow and travel the world
Pewd is the true king of YouTube. Constantly evolving and improving on his content after all these years, it’s amazing honestly.
6:51 I actually laughed out loud at that commentary, YouTube hasn’t done that for me in a while. Cool video and editing, and I am happy to follow along on yet another pewds journey.

I really like how the japanese series reflected the soft soul of Marzia and how chill it is to watch those kind of videos, but even though this one was very different, it made me laught so much, defenitly more than being better or worst, is just a different style. got me many laughts
You sound a lot happier than usual, very epic and high energy!. Imagine casually going to a Japanese arcade and meeting pewdiepie..
This was of the most poetic YouTube videos I have ever seen. ‘My Heart Will Go On’ in Japanese was the sweetest sorrow. So very impressive of Felix, and another world to come to know.
You know, I like these more than just video reactions!  This is fresh and exciting :) not in the realm of content creation but in the scope of what pewds usually produces.

honestly this is just a joy to watch. certainly did not except this type of content from Felix

edit: those scrolling rythm games where the inputs use touch controls are so genius. they look so much more fun and intuitive
I love how you break down complex ideas into understandable chunks. It makes learning enjoyable and accessible.
Glad to see Felix shining some light on japanese rhythm games, a genre many people forget about

This makes me feel young again but with a sense of maturity. I love the way he edited the video it feels like he put his soul into the vid and I really enjoy it. I hope he works on his next videos like this.
He seems so much more relaxed and happy in Japan. I love it! Keep enjoying yourself Felix.
Pretty sweet vid! I really enjoyed getting a taste of Japanese culture. It's so interesting that a lot of the games in the arcade use cards as an added gimmick to immerse you in the experience.

Wow this was a fast, informative, fun, quick video that was super easy to watch! Can't believe 13 minutes felt like 3 but definitely wanting to visit Japan the more I watch enjoyable content like this revolving around Japan. Kudos.

5:43 I'M NOT LOSING TO A KID'S GAME!!

LMAO

I think the style worked really well for a pewdiepie-video and for what the content is all about! Adding all the different elements: Tier list, narrated parts, "live reaction" parts, jokes. It all combined really nicely for what felt like a well-edited piece of content while also remaining a genuine expression of the experience. Exited to see more stuff like this.
This is the collab we needed. Pewdiepie and pewdiepie is the best duo ever.
Seeing pewds so happy was so wholesome to me c:
Japan is not just rich in culture, it’s also full of retro and 90s vibes
I think collabing with pewdiepie was a great choice, I hope to see this collab again in the future!
So much energy in this video. The music, the editing, pewds' commentary. It's like a Mr Beast video
Loved this type of editing, Felix! You did such a good job on this and we felt as though we're with you trying out the games. So much fun
I think this was the best PewDiePie video i've seen in years. Please more of this content! That Magic: The Gathering joke was spot on.
Wow, didnt know games like this existed. Japanese arcades are on another level
13:17 the sky in the afternoon is what i always imagined when someday i visit japan

This is definitely a different editing and story-telling style than your past handful of videos(generally in quite awhile as well imo). It's pretty amazing that you're experimenting even now; proving with your actions that you're just into YouTube for the fun of it and don't mind not falling into the typical YouTube copy and paste past success formula. I'll enjoy any other styles you want to experiment with :D
Japanese arcades are literally like walking through a time machine to the past* (happy now)
Most of the time felix actually played more rhythm games than normal arcade games...

This was too entertaining Felix! Loved this style of video 
Ill watch you have fun throughout your day/week anytime cause this was a joy to watch
This video feels like a mix between the 2014 pewdiepie and the modern chill pewdiepie....great stuff

7:00 I salute you for being able to stand there and dance awkwardly alone and film on top of that. As an introvert this is near impossible for me and even paying me wouldn't make me do it lol. This video felt different from the usual vibe you have, it feels similar to the style you had on your 0 death Elden Ring challenge video, if I were to describe it shortly then it probably is "Scripted Pewdiepie mode". It's kinda refreshing and I like it a lot.

3:00 i love this game too, i spend over an hour on it
so many songs i known how to play

I haven't watched a Pewdiepie video in a while but holy I absolutely LOVE this style of video, I don't know if you've been doing it for a while or experimenting with the commentary and such but it's awesome
Love seeing Felix have fun and edit the video himself! Felt like I was there playing with a friend <3

You'll never get arcade games like this here in the UK, they definitely thought about it and came up with awesome ideas how to interact with the games more, Pewds definitely had fun and felt awkward at the same time lol

Really nice content PewDiePie, I love arcade very much
2:45 Played this game & Initial D Arcade the first time yesterday in my Singapore trip, really fun game! 
Hope they are available in Malaysia
felix just doing what he loves. watching these videos of him enjoying his time fills parts of me that makes me happy. happy for you felix. keep on doing what you love.
6:15 of course it's fire, it's Ado
A really good inside look on Japanese cultures arcades. Honestly something I've wanna to see since like you said, childhood. Looks like you had a fun time man.

My all time favorite arcade cabnit was one I usually found at Round 1 by Square Enix called Gunslinger Stratos. It used a cool pair of light guns with controlls on them, and the gimmick was that depending on the character, u had 5 weapons: 1 in each hand, 2 combining the guns either sideways or top and bottom through magnet sliders, and a melee option by putting the guns down by your sides. It looks like it was imported from Japan, so if you find it, try that one, very fun, I plan to get one for my self in the far future.

Love the passion in this one. I’m not gonna lie, whenever I’ve been in a Japanese arcade I get intimidated that there’s a level of Japanese required ‘to do well’ which I’m sure there is sometimes, but it stops me from just going for it because public anxiety  I feel like the volume Felix is speaking at is different. It’s like, I’m expecting book review level energy and maybe that difference is an adjustment for viewers but the dialogue feels a bit too constructed. Totally has to be with that many games I suppose otherwise you wouldn’t remember what to say. But I’m so glad he’s having fun with it and we’re getting content like this!

There's a lot of videos out there showcasing what Japan has to offer, but I haven't been following those channels for about 10 years so seeing your perspective on these adventures is what helps to make these videos so enjoyable, along with you just being such a good content creator.
Such a different style of video from you, and I can tell how much effort went into it! Amazing work Felix, and I'm glad you're having a blast in Japan!
I would love to go to Japan to see its monuments and also go to the nintendo and playstation combinations and going to the nintendo park would be something fun
I don't know what it is, but this is really refreshing for some reason

I am Japanese.  "You must wear gloves when playing maimai."  "Let's use gloves that slide well."  Also, if CHUNITHM uses gloves, your fingers won't get tired.

And one more!  The first game, ONGEKI, is a game in which you hold the lever with your left hand and press the buttons with your right!
Compared to Japanese Arcades, British Arcades look like they're from the 1980s
Japan arcade is 50% rhythm game and 50% Mech
6:01 "I highly recommend if you have friends"
Fuck sake, Felix. This is one of my DAMN dreams rn. Just spending a ton of time in Japanese arcades. You seemed so genuinely happy and like you were having a fun time. Super enjoyed this vid!
Consider this, longtime fans.  He's back to playing games in a way, and he's happy doing so.  This is the best route XD
this is such an old style of video and i'm all for it. makes life feel a bit slower which is nice

The classic intro was a nostalgic slap in the face, holy shit.
Didn’t know how much I missed hearing it lol

Loved this vid ! The amusements are so different in Japan , I hope I can go there one day soon for a nice little holiday , Japan looks amazing and your vlogs have definitely helped me to choose it as a future holiday destination
Love the new style videos, been a fan for almost 10 years and the content just keeps getting better! keep it up pewds <3
Although unrelated to this video, the games in this video are especially popular in Japan: Taiko no Tatsujin, CHUNITHM, maimai, SOUND VOLTEX, and beatmania.

Thank you for playing these games!
Personally my favorites are Sound Voltex, Beatmania IIDX, and WACCA (Though I'm really sad that WACCA is offline now...)
IIDX is definitely a game that is super hard for anyone to get into because the control scheme isn't made for human hands, but once you spend hours getting past beginner stuff, it's honestly my favorite game ever. Super fun and really good music.

Why do I feel like Felix edited this video himself. It got more personality on it. He can do whatever he wants now and not worrying about chasing those numbers up. Feels like he had his peace of mind. It's actually refreshing. You can see he's got No more pressure
Felix is just having fun now, and I think that's awesome.
9:28 "I actually love it, I would give it an ass" cant unhear it

It's really cool that you felt comfortable to do this(despite the odd awkward moments you felt uncomfy) because you didn't get pestered by anyone, like your privacy is a lot more respected in Japan.

I know you already made a video about your move to Japan, but it would be cool if you could make another one like, How is it playing games/calling with your friends back in the UK/US, is it still possible or is the ping a big issue? and since you moved a whole continent, do you worry about visiting your friends, and how hard that may be given the flight time and costs etc?

I'm loving your content recently, it seems like you're sharing something you enjoy, very naturally with your viewers, super entertaining to watch, especially now the content is about Japan theres a lot of cultural aspects that are interesting and beautiful, but also a lot of nerdy stuff that I love seeing you explore!
I like this kind of video format. The narrating aspect is something Felix doesn't do much of. Really good video.
That drum game looks like the Donkey Kong bongos haha
That commentry was unexpected and so hilarious loved the video. Love all the random stuff you do.
As a Japanese I’m really happy that he is enjoying Japan even the weird parts as this arcade
I love how authentic and courageous you still are. Still a great solo cameraman. <3
I adore Felix's editing, so pure, so chill
This whole thing felt like an ad for the arcade lmao. But it looked like he had so much fun. So wholesome
Awesome job Felix hope you had an awesome time you look so happy in Japan so glad for you and Marzia living your best life

I've got a Japanese arcade near my home, and the rhythm games are the reason to go. As you said, they feel very unique to the arcade, and even though I don't know most of the songs, running into the occasional random Undertale song or Attack on Titan op, and getting to interact while listening is always enjoyable.

That one line from his song really came true @12:30,
"Got that enchanted shit, Lapis Lazuli my gamer."
as some one from the UK its nice seeing an arcade with games for fun rather than mainly gambling games
This was a great video Felix!! Love the style of narration you did with this and hope to see more like it in the future! Always happy to see you enjoying Japan

For people who want to play in a Japanese Arcade, you should bring wired headphones or earbuds. Most of them have a headphone jack, and it's much nicer to play with headphones on as the surrounding is usually quite noisy.
Seeing Felix playing play fate arcade is a blessing as a fate fan , ranking was justified because he knows the gacha rates
The most fun and enjoyable video Pewds has ever uploaded in a while... for me.

To me, this kind of editing and style of the video is very informative and makes me want to go to Japan, more and more to try out all the arcade and food and attractions that you have seen. Honestly, I would love to see more videos like this!
0:11 HE DID THE THING
Pewds: "gambling is bad". Also Pewds: "Horse Track S tier game."
Honestly one of your best videos yet. This was a really fun to watch small journey through a Japanese arcade
10:20 I would never expect there will be gunjou sanka from project sekai in felix video
Yo this style of video is much harder to do so thank you for making this. It's instantly so fun to watch. And your comments are so funny too!

Everyone: Hey you played all the games in the arcade 










Me:Why not mario kart?

I love Felix's videos so much, I wish they were longer, the content is priceless and I wanna watch every step!! 
Great job Sive for editing, I'm sure it was SO MUCH FUN editing 12 hours of Pewd's gaming.
